title.rendered: Top Esports Games To Bet On

content.rendered:
Image Source

Top Esports Games To Bet On

Esports betting is becoming increasingly common among the young generation of sports bettors. This new form of betting started a slow start, but it has gained a lot of momentum in recent years. That’s why Esports betting is slowly but steadily gaining traction among bookmakers right now.

There are several esports betting sites or an online Casino reviews you could choose from, as well as a larger number of esports games to wager on. But there are Esports games that go to the top in terms of popularity and wide betting capability, so here they are.

DOTA 2 

The Esports tournaments for Defense of the Ancients 2 or simply called Dota 2, are not only one of the highest-paid in the world but also one of the most profitable to bet. But being successful at betting in Dota 2 is not just being good at the game. It is a difficult task, to be sure, because you have to be also knowledgeable about the top-tier teams, take accounts of the newest lineups, as well as the past, present, and future meta.

The International is the most prestigious yearly competition exclusively designed for the best Dota 2 players to participate in. It is so popular that many bettors are going to top-up to raise the prize pool and profits in betting that in 2020, the winning teams were paid more than $40 million in this single competition.

League of Legends

League of Legends or LOL is without a doubt one of the most famous esports for wagering. It is, in reality, the game that sparked the entire esports boom. If a League of Legends team finishes in the top 3, they will be awarded cash prizes worth millions of dollars.

And if you have bet on one of the top three teams means you have the percentage share of the prize with respect to the bookmakers you have placed your bets. That’s why it is no wonder that this is the most famous game for betting.

The World Championship, the most prestigious tournament for the League of Legends players, had multi-million revenues up to $6.5 million in 2020 means the game is fastly gaining its popularity in the betting world.

Counter-Strike: Global Offensive

Since it launched in 1999, the Counter-Strike franchise has been adored by several generations of gamers. Until this recent version of its series, which is the Counter-Strike: Global Offensive, has gained popularity in the European region, and it has been the favorite grounds for the bettors to wager on.

The new version of the Counter-Strike franchise is popular among bookmakers because it is oriented towards team competition. Counter-Strike: Global Offensive is simple to learn for the new players who are also interested in its betting, making it a popular wagering choice for newcomers to esports.

This year BLAST Premier 2021 is one of the most awaited tournaments for CSGO players around the globe. With a prize pool of about $2.5 million, for sure it is also the awaited event for common CSGO players and bettors.

StarCraft II

StarCraft: Brood War is regarded as one of the most famous esports games today, especially in South Korea and other East Asia parts. It is so popular that it has its rating system and even a dedicated television channel to the game.

Betting in StarCraft is similar to other popular esports games in that it focuses on outright results of games and tournaments, as well as which players will advance to the finals. StarCraft’s top tournament, the StarCraft II World Championship, is the highest regarded on all of its players, with a prize pool of $400,000 in 2020.

It is not as high as the esports games mentioned above, but it is fast climbing. That’s why if you go for your favorite betting website during one of the StarCraft tournaments, you can almost certainly find it in the betting deals.

Takeaway

The fascination of most young adult bettors with the popular game names, gameplay, and mechanics makes esports an appealing choice for gaining profits. However, learning how to bet on esports is one thing but knowing how to make money from esports betting is another thing.

It all comes down to how much time and effort you are able to put into esports betting. And that said, it is not about betting on the most successful esports games or their profit potential.
